Class RedistrictingStatistics

java.lang.Object
metrocs.redistricting.RedistrictingStatistics
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class RedistrictingStatistics extends Object implements Serializable
Utility methods for computing party preference statistics of districts.

The statistics indicate which party holds a plurality of voters in each district. If multiple parties share the largest number of voters in a district, that district is considered to have no preference and is counted under Party.NONE.

Version:
20250808.0
Author:
Dr. Jody Paul, OpenAI ChatGPT

  • Method Details

    • districtPreference

      public static Party districtPreference(District district, Region region)
      Determines the preferred party for a district.

      The preferred party is the one with the most voters in the district. If no single party has a plurality, Party.NONE is returned.

      Parameters:
      district - the district to analyze
      region - the region containing the voters
      Returns:
      the party that holds the plurality of voters; Party.NONE if there is no single-party plurality
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null

    • computePartyPreferences

      public static Map<Party,Integer> computePartyPreferences(Set<District> districts, Region region)
      Computes party preference statistics for a redistricting.
      Parameters:
      districts - the set of districts comprising the redistricting
      region - the region containing the voters
      Returns:
      a mapping from party to the number of districts preferring that party; Party.NONE counts districts with no preference
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null

    • countPartyPreferences

      public static Map<Party,Integer> countPartyPreferences(Region region)
      Counts the number of voters in the specified region that are affiliated with each Party.
      Parameters:
      region - the region to analyze; may be null
      Returns:
      map associating each party with the number of voters affiliated with that party

    • formatPartyPreferences

      public static String formatPartyPreferences(Region region)
      Produce a human-readable summary of party preference statistics for the given region. The summary lists the number and percentage of voters for each party.
      Parameters:
      region - the region to analyze; may be null
      Returns:
      summary string describing party preferences

    • formatDistrictPreferences

      public static String formatDistrictPreferences(Set<District> districts, Region region)
      Produce a human-readable summary of party preferences for a collection of districts. The summary lists the number and percentage of districts preferring each party.
      Parameters:
      districts - the districts to analyze; may be null
      region - the region containing the voters; may be null
      Returns:
      summary string describing district party preferences
